Stack NativeGeometry

NativeSoft NativeGeometry Library. The most advanced geometry manager for LiveCode.

Description

NativeGeometry is the most advanced geometry manager for LiveCode, by NativeSoft.

NativeGeometry features:
- Object oriented geometry setting API
- Intelligent relation dependency solver
- Geometry compilation compiler, for the fastest resizing experience
- Object resizing engine, that allow you to create application that are:
- - Cross platform
- - Localizable
- Scale engine that allow you to create application that are:
- - DPI Aware
- - More accessible
- - Support all resolutions on mobile!
- Conditional geometry relation

The API specification has been grouped inside packages, in order to help any developper to find quickly the function/command that they need.

Documented with NativeSoft NativeDoc.


How to implement NativeGeometry inside your application.
Inside the Revolution enviroment, the NativeGeometry library is loaded automatically by the NativeGeometry Revolution plugins, but as a standalone you have to built-in NativeGeometry inside your main stack in order to have NativeGeometry workings.

Place the following code inside your main stack (that is used to create the standalone):

on SavingStandalone
ng_SavingStandalone
end SavingStandalone

For your mobile application:
on savingMobileStandalone
ng_SavingStandalone
save me -- Specified in android livecode note
end savingMobileStandalone

And place the following code inside your application loader script:
on startup
-- Opening NativeGeometry
open invisible stack (the ng_stack of me)

-- On iOS, setting that the application has to use all pixel of the devices
if the platform is "iphone" then iphoneUseDeviceResolution true, true

-- Setting the scale value for this platform
ng_setConfig "scale", ng_getSystemScale()

pass startup
end startup

You can also place the following code in your preopenstack to have the best font on any platform:
on preopenstack
-- Setting the font for this platform.
ng_setStackFont ng_getSystemFont(), (the name of this stack)

pass preopenstack
end preopenstack

That's all, the application is ready to be built using NativeGeometry.

Upgrading from NativeGeometry 2
To upgrade your application to NativeGeometry 3, you have to copy the code above. (startup, preopenstack, savingMobileStandalone)

Important note for people upgrading from NativeGeometry 2!
NativeGeometry has now a scaling feature, this means that you don't have anymore to manually handle the font size change.

So, if you were adapting manually the font size of your application, you have to remove this code and set the font and font size to the default font and fontsize of the platform. (eg. Segoe UI 12 on Windows Vista)

Then, you will be able to scale all your text with NativeGeometry using the ng_setConfig command.

Downgrading to NativeGeometry 2
IMPORTANT: NativeGeometry 3 updated the internal database format.

To downgrade your stack to be used on NativeGeometry 2, you have to download and install NativeGeometry 2.2 that handle the convertion of NativeGeometry 3 databases to 2.

Note: NativeGeometry 3 and NativeGeometry 2.2 automatically upgrade/downgrade the database format.

Objects, Scripts and Properties
Package Application Compilation Package
Package Configuration Package
Package Database Package
Package Engine Package
Package Font utilities Package
Package Geometry Management Package
Package Log Package
Package Utilities Package
On libraryStack Inits NativeGeometry library.
On preOpenCard Launches NativeGeometry before the card to be displayed.
On preopenstack Init of the NativeGeometry library. Must be called in order to have NativeGeometry working.
On resizeStack Launches NativeGeometry of the resized stack.
Function ng_ver() Returns the version of NativeGeometry.
Warning

NativeGeometry 2 break API compability with NativeSpeak 1.0.

Notes
The namespace of NativeGeometry is "ng_"
As Damien Girard is not a native english speaker, sometimes the documentation looks more Frenglish (French + English) than English. Do not hesitate to send your feedbacks at dgirard@nativesoft.fr
NativeGeometry 3.0 is API compliant with NativeGeometry 2.2.
Version

3.0
